 
{{Server client function}}
{{New feature/item|3.0160|1.6|9768|This function gets the type of a userdata value, which is not always a [[/element.md|element]] in the element tree.}}

==Syntax==
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
string getUserdataType ( userdata value )
</syntaxhighlight>

===Required Arguments=== 
*'''value''': A userdata value to get the type of. Userdata types can be:
**'''SHARED'''
***''resource-data'': a [[/Resource.md|resource pointer]].
***''xml-node'': a [[/Xmlnode.md|XML node]].
***''lua-timer'': a [[/timer.md|timer]].
***''vector2'': a 2D vector, used in the [[/Vector/Vector2.md|Vector2]] class.
***''vector3'': a 3D vector, used in the [[/Vector/Vector3.md|Vector3]] class.
***''vector4'': a 4D vector, used in the [[/Vector/Vector4.md|Vector4]] class.
***''matrix'': a matrix, used in the [[/Matrix.md|Matrix]] class.
***''userdata'': a fallback userdata type return value, when no other type could be found for the object.
**'''SERVER ONLY'''
***''account'': a [[/Account.md|player account]].
***''db-query'': a [[/dbQuery.md|database query handle]].
***''acl'': an [[/ACL.md|ACL entry]].
***''acl-group'': an [[/Aclgroup.md|ACL group]].
***''ban'': a [[/Ban.md|player ban]].
***''text-item'': a [[/Textitem.md|text display item]].
***''text-display'': a [[/Textdisplay.md|text display item]].
<!-- I don't think that this userdata type is used in current MTA versions. According to the source, is serverside only.
     Source code commit: https://github.com/multitheftauto/mtasa-blue/commit/df8576fc3f80fa2d7a73e70a68e8f116b591cb68#diff-09a3546021ff952dc0f94a99aae11356R297
***''weapon'': a [[/Weapon.md|custom weapon]].
-->

===Returns===
Returns a [[/string.md|string]] containing the specified userdata's type, or ''false'' plus an error message if the given value is not userdata.

==Example== 
This example shows a function that can be used to work around the impossibility to transfer vectors as arguments when using [[/triggerClientEvent.md|triggerClientEvent]] and [[/triggerServerEvent.md|triggerServerEvent]], by converting them into a table which can be used safely.
<syntaxhighlight lang="lua">
function safeArgsForTransfer(...)
    local args = { ... }
    for index, arg in ipairs(args) do
        if type(arg) == "userdata" and getUserdataType(arg):match("vector") then
            -- Transform every kind of vector userdata to a table which can be transfered safely
            args[index] =
            {
                arg:getX(),
                arg:getY(),
                arg.getZ and arg:getZ() or nil,
                arg.getW and arg:getW() or nil,
                -- Extra field to distinguish from normal tables
                ["isVectorWorkaround"] = true
            }
        end
    end
    return unpack(args)
end
</syntaxhighlight>
